newsitem.title: USA: Signal Apparel says gets $67 mln in credit.
newsitem.headline: Signal Apparel says gets $67 mln in credit.

text.p: Signal Apparel Co said Tuesday it it has entered into an agreement in principle with its senior lender for a $67 million credit facility.

The new agreement will adjust and extend through March 31, 2000 the current credit facility. The new $67 million credit facility will consist primarily of a $33 million revolving advance account which is similar in terms to the company's current revolving advance account and a $34 million additional facility. The additional facility replaces the existing $14 million overadvance facility. Borrowing availability depends upon a formula whose variables include level of inventory and receivables, among other things.

Signal said it anticipates that the new facility will adequately cover its credit needs through 1997, based upon the company's current operating plan. The company said the agreement is subject to final documentation and is expected to be finalized by mid-April.
